english: obscure and unknown (idiom); an outsider without any reputation/a nobody/an unknown quantity
lit. a dagger hidden in smiles (idiom); friendly manners belying hypocritical intentions/when the fox preaches, look to the geese
lit. to wash one's hands in a gold basin (idiom)/fig. to abandon the life of an outlaw
lit. to toss a stone to find out what's ahead (idiom)/fig. to test the waters
lit. red-bellied devotion (idiom); wholehearted loyalty/to serve sb with body and soul
of noble character and unquestionable integrity (idiom)
front yard as busy as a marketplace (idiom)/a place with many visitors
abbr. for 瓜田不納履，李下不整冠|瓜田不纳履，李下不整冠[gua1 tian2 bu4 na4 lu:3 , li3 xia4 bu4 zheng3 guan1]
lit. hiding the moon, shaming the flowers (idiom)/fig. female beauty exceeding even that of the natural world
lit. fish sink, goose alights (idiom, from Zhuangzi 莊子|庄子); fig. female beauty captivating even the birds and beasts
neither servile nor overbearing (idiom)/neither obsequious nor supercilious
